newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan sell August fuel oil at $123/T, $132/T.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan sell August fuel oil at $123/T, $132/T.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has sold by tender two 38,000-tonne fuel oil cargoes at $132 and $123 per tonne for August delivery, a company official said on Thursday.

The first 0.5-percent cargo was sold at around $132 per tonne and the second 1.0-percent cargo, with an American Petroleum Institute (API) gravity of 15 degrees and a viscosity of 140-centistoke, was sold at about $123 per tonne.
Both cargoes are for August 16-30 delivery on a cost-and-freight (C+F) basis, the official said.
The tender closed on July 8 and was valid for two days.
In its last tender, CPC bought one 38,000-tonne cargo of 0.5-percent sulphur, low-pour fuel oil at more than $127 per tonne for July 21-August 15 delivery on a c+f basis.
